Package org.mitre.synthea.world.geography

Class Demographics

java.lang.Object
org.mitre.synthea.world.geography.Demographics
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Demographics>
public class Demographics
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Demographics>, java.io.Serializable
Demographics class holds the information from the towns.json and associated county config files. This data is used to build up a synthetic population matching these real-world statistics. A single instance of Demographics represents a single city or town. The Ages, Gender, Race, Income, and Education properties are maps of frequency information. TODO: add ways to better wrap these maps so they are more accessible and useful. TODO: merge this with Location somehow. they probably don't need to be separate classes
See Also:

      Returns:

    • languageFromRaceAndEthnicity

      public java.lang.String languageFromRaceAndEthnicity​(java.lang.String race, java.lang.String ethnicity, java.util.Random random)
      Selects a language based on race and ethnicity. For those of Hispanic ethnicity, language statistics are pulled from the national distribution of spoken languages. For non-Hispanic, national distributions by race are used.
      Parameters:
      race - US Census race
      ethnicity - "hispanic" or "nonhispanic"
      random - random to use
      Returns:
      the language spoken

    • pickIncome

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the income

    • incomeLevel

      public double incomeLevel​(int income)
      Simple linear formula just maps federal poverty level to 0.0 and 75,000 to 1.0. The 75,000 figure was chosen based on https://www.princeton.edu/~deaton/downloads/ deaton_kahneman_high_income_improves_evaluation_August2010.pdf.

    • pickEducation

      public java.lang.String pickEducation​(java.util.Random random)
      Return a random education level based on statistics.

    • educationLevel

      public double educationLevel​(java.lang.String level, java.util.Random random)
      Return a random number between the configured bounds for a specified education level.

    • socioeconomicScore

    • load

      public static com.google.common.collect.Table<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String,​Demographics> load​(java.lang.String state) throws java.io.IOException
      Get a Table of (State, CityId, Demographics), with the given restrictions on state and city.
      Parameters:
      state - The state that is desired. Other states will be excluded from the results.
      Returns:
      Table of (State, CityId, Demographics)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any exception occurs in reading the demographics file
